snippet: The Swiss mining giant Glencore has announced a $10.2 billion plan to cut debt and issue shares to adapt to plunging market prices.
abstract: Swiss mining company Glencore, hoping to reduce debt and adapt to  market volatility, will suspend its dividend, sell $2 million in assets and further reduce capital expenditures; also plans to issue $2.5 billion in shares.
lead_paragraph: The Swiss mining giant Glencore has announced a $10.2 billion plan to cut debt and issue shares to adapt to plunging market prices.

headline.main: Glencore to Cut Debt, Adjusting to Volatility
headline.print_headline: Glencore to Cut Debt, Adjusting to Volatility
